verses.text: Wisdom lifteth up the head of \add him that is\add* of low degree, And maketh him to sit among great men.
Commend not a man for his beauty; Neither abhor a man for his outward appearance.
The bee \add is\add* little among such as fly; But her fruit \add is\add* the chief of sweet things.
Boast not of \add thy\add* clothing and raiment, And exalt not thyself in the day of honour: For the works of the Lord \add are\add* wonderful, And his works among men \add are\add* hidden.
Many kings have sit down upon the ground; And one that was never thought of hath worn the crown.
Many mighty men have been greatly disgraced; And the honourable delivered into other \add men\add*â€™s hands.
Blame not before thou hast examined \add the truth:\add* Understand first, and then rebuke.
Answer not before \add thou\add* hast heard \add the cause:\add* Neither interrupt \add men\add* in the midst of \add their\add* talk.
Strive not in a matter that concerneth thee not; And sit not in judgment with sinners.
\add My\add* son, meddle not with many matters: For if thou meddle much, thou shalt not be innocent; And if thou follow \add after\add*, thou shalt not obtain, Neither shalt thou escape by fleeing.
There is one that laboureth, and taketh pains, and maketh haste, And is so much the more behind.

\add Again\add*, there is \add another that is\add* slow, and hath need of help, Wanting ability, and full of poverty; Yet the eye of the Lord looked upon him for good, And set him up from his low estate,
And lifted up his head from misery; So that many that saw \add it\add* marvelled at him.
Prosperity and adversity, life and death, Poverty and riches, come of the Lord.
Wisdom, knowledge, and understanding of the law, \add are\add* of the Lord: Love, and the way of good works, are from him.
Error and darkness had their beginning together with sinners: And evil shall wax old with them that glory therein.
The gift of the Lord remaineth with the godly, And his favour bringeth prosperity for ever.
There is that waxeth rich by his wariness and pinching, And this \add is\add* the portion of his reward:

Whereas he saith, I have found rest, And now will eat continually of my goods; And \add yet\add* he knoweth not what time shall come upon him, And \add that\add* he must leave those \add things\add* to others, and die.
Be stedfast in thy covenant, and be conversant therein, And wax old in thy work.
Marvel not at the works of sinners; But trust in the Lord, and abide in thy labour: For \add it is\add* an easy \add thing\add* in the sight of the Lord on the sudden to make a poor man rich.
The blessing of the Lord \add is\add* in the reward of the godly, And suddenly he maketh his blessing to flourish.
Say not, What profit is there of my service? And what good \add things\add* shall I have hereafter?
\add Again\add*, say not, I have enough, and possess many \add things\add*, And what evil can come to me hereafter?
In the day of prosperity \add there is\add* a forgetfulness of affliction: And in the day of affliction there is no remembrance of prosperity.
For \add it is\add* an easy \add thing\add* unto the Lord in the day of death To reward a man according to his ways.
The affliction of an hour maketh \add a man\add* forget pleasure: And in his end his deeds shall be discovered.
Judge none blessed before \add his\add* death: For a man shall be known in his children.
Bring not every man into thine house: For the deceitful \add man hath\add* many trains.
\add Like as\add* a partridge taken \add and kept\add* in a cage, so \add is\add* the heart of the proud; And like as a spy, watcheth \add he\add* for \add thy\add* fall:
For he lieth in wait, and turneth good into evil, And in \add things\add* worthy praise will lay blame upon \add thee\add*.
Of a spark of fire a heap of coals is kindled: And a sinful man layeth wait for blood.
Take heed of a mischievous \add man\add*, for he worketh wickedness; Lest he bring upon thee a perpetual blot.
Receive a stranger into thine house, and he will disturb thee, And turn thee out of thine own.
